老.definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity; old (of people); venerable (person); experienced; of long standing; always; all the time; of the past; very; outdated; (of meat etc) tough

老丈.definition: sir (respectful form of address for an old man)

老三篇.definition: Lao San Pian, three short essays written by Mao Zedong before the PRC was established

老三色.definition: the three plain colors used for clothing in the PRC in the 1960s: black, gray and blue

老不死.definition: (derog.) old but still alive; old fart; old bastard

老二.definition: second-eldest child in a family; (euphemism) penis

老人.definition: old man or woman; the elderly; one's aged parents or grandparents

老人家.definition: polite term for old woman or man

老伯.definition: uncle (polite form of address for older male)

老伯伯.definition: grandpa (polite form of address for old man)

老伴.definition: (of an elderly couple) husband or wife

老伴兒.definition: erhua variant of 老伴[lao3 ban4]

老佛爺.definition: title of respect for the queen mother or the emperor's father; nickname for Empress Dowager Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4]

老來俏.definition: old person who dresses up as teenager; mutton dressed as lamb

老傢伙.definition: variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]

老兄.definition: elder brother (often used self-referentially); (form of address between male friends) old chap; buddy

老公.definition: (coll.) eunuch; see also 老公[lao3 gong1]

老公公.definition: old man; husband's father; father-in-law; court eunuch

老兵.definition: old soldier; veteran; veteran (sb who has a lot of experience in some domain)

老化.definition: (of a person, population or material) to age; (of knowledge) to become outdated

老友.definition: old friend; sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)

老古板.definition: overly conservative; old-fashioned; old fogey; a square

老君.definition: Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, founder of Taoism

老吾老，以及人之老.pinyin: lao3 wu2 lao3 , yi3 ji2 ren2 zhi1 lao3
老吾老，以及人之老.definition: to honor old people as we do our own aged parents

老吾老，以及人之老，幼吾幼，以及人之幼.pinyin: lao3 wu2 lao3 , yi3 ji2 ren2 zhi1 lao3 , you4 wu2 you4 , yi3 ji2 ren2 zhi1 you4
老吾老，以及人之老，幼吾幼，以及人之幼.definition: to honor old people as we do our own aged parents, and care for other's children as one's own

老地方.definition: same place as before; usual place; stomping ground

老城.definition: old town; old district of a city

老外.definition: (coll.) foreigner (esp. non Asian person); layman; amateur

老大.definition: old age; very; eldest child in a family; leader of a group; boss; captain of a boat; leader of a criminal gang

老大媽.definition: "Madam" (affectionate term for an elderly woman); CL:位[wei4]

老天爺餓不死瞎家雀.pinyin: lao3 tian1 ye2 e4 bu4 si3 xia1 jia1 que4
老天爺餓不死瞎家雀.definition: lit. heaven won't let the sparrows go hungry (idiom); fig. don't give up hope; if you tough it out, there will be light at the end of the tunnel

老套.definition: hackneyed; well-worn (phrase etc); same old story; stereotypical fashion

老奶奶.definition: (coll.) father's father's mother; paternal great-grandmother; respectful form of address for an old woman

老奸巨滑.definition: variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]

老好人.definition: one who tries never to offend anybody

老姥.definition: old lady; (old woman's self-reference) I, me

老娘.definition: my old mother; I, this old woman; my old lady (colloquial); maternal grandmother; midwife

老婆孩子熱炕頭.pinyin: lao3 po2 hai2 zi5 re4 kang4 tou5
老婆孩子熱炕頭.definition: wife, kids and a warm bed (idiom); the simple and good life

老子.definition: father; daddy; "I, your father" (in anger, or out of contempt); I (used arrogantly or jocularly)

老子英雄兒好漢，老子反動兒混蛋.pinyin: lao3 zi5 ying1 xiong2 er2 hao3 han4 , lao3 zi5 fan3 dong4 er2 hun2 dan4
老子英雄兒好漢，老子反動兒混蛋.definition: If the father is a hero, the son is a real man. If the father is a reactionary, the son is a bastard. (Cultural Revolution slogan); fig. like father, like son

老字號.definition: shop, firm, or brand of merchandise with a long-established reputation

老客兒.definition: erhua variant of 老客[lao3 ke4]

老家.definition: native place; place of origin; home state or region

老將.definition: lit. old general; commander-in-chief 將帥|将帅, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess; fig. old-timer; veteran

老小.definition: the old and the young; the youngest member of the family

老小老小.definition: (coll.) as one ages, one becomes more and more like a child

老少無欺.definition: cheating neither old nor young; treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously; Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.

老少皆宜.definition: suitable for both the young and the old

老山自行車館.pinyin: Lao3 shan1 Zi4 xing2 che1 guan3
老山自行車館.definition: Laoshan Velodrome, a Beijing 2008 Olympics venue

老年.definition: elderly; old age; autumn of one's years

老年性痴獃症.pinyin: lao3 nian2 xing4 chi1 dai1 zheng4

老幾.definition: where in the order of seniority among siblings?; (sometimes used in rhetorical questions to express disparagement)

老弟.definition: (affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy; old pal

老態.definition: old and frail; decrepit; doddering; decrepitude; infirmities of old age

老成持重.definition: old and wise; experienced and knowledgeable

老手.definition: experienced person; an old hand at sth

老掉牙.definition: very old; obsolete; out of date

老於世故.definition: experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise; sophisticated

老旦.definition: old woman role in Chinese opera

老本.definition: capital; assets; savings; nest egg; (fig.) reputation; laurels (to rest upon); old edition of a book; (tree) trunk

老朽.definition: decrepit and behind the times; old; useless; (humble) I; me (used by the elderly)

老板.definition: variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]

老樣子.definition: old situation; things as they were

老殘遊記.definition: The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]

老毛病.definition: chronic illness; old weakness; chronic problem

老氣橫秋.definition: old and decrepit; proud of one's age and experience (idiom)

老江湖.definition: a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world

老河口市.definition: Laohekou, county-level city in Xiangyang 襄陽市|襄阳市[Xiang1yang2 Shi4], Hubei

老漢.definition: old man; I (an old man referring to himself)

老烏恰.definition: same as 烏魯克恰提|乌鲁克恰提 in Xinjiang

老煙槍.definition: heavy smoker; chain smoker; life-long smoker

老爺子.definition: my (your etc) old father; polite appellation for an elderly male

老爺嶺.definition: Chinese name for Sichote-Alin mountain range in Russia's Primorsky Krai around Vladivostok

老牌.definition: old, well-known brand; old style; old school; an old hand; experienced veteran

老牛吃嫩草.definition: lit. an old cow eats young grass (idiom); fig. a May-December relationship; a romance where the man is significantly older than the woman

老牛拉破車.definition: see 老牛破車|老牛破车[lao3 niu2 po4 che1]

老牛破車.definition: lit. old ox pulling a shabby cart (idiom); fig. slow and inefficient

老牛舐犢.definition: lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom); fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children

老王賣瓜，自賣自誇.pinyin: Lao3 Wang2 mai4 gua1 , zi4 mai4 zi4 kua1
老王賣瓜，自賣自誇.definition: every potter praises his own pot (idiom); all one's geese are swans

老生.definition: venerable middle-aged or elderly man, usually wearing an artificial beard (in Chinese opera)

老生常談.definition: an old observation (idiom); a truism; banal comments

老當益壯.definition: old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years

老百姓.definition: ordinary people; the "person in the street"; CL:個|个[ge4]

老皇曆.definition: (lit.) past years' almanac; (fig.) ancient history; obsolete practice; old-fashioned principle

老眼昏花.definition: blurred vision of an old person (idiom)

老總.definition: boss; sir (person with a leading role in an organization); (after a surname) high ranking commander in the PLA; (Qing dynasty) high ranking government official; (old) courteous term used by the general populace in addressing a rank-and-file soldier or police officer

老繭.definition: callus (patch or hardened skin); corns (on feet); also 老趼

老美.definition: (coll.) an American; person from the United States

老羞成怒.definition: see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3xiu1-cheng2nu4]

老老.definition: maternal grandmother; same as 姥姥

老耄.definition: dim sight of the aged; doddering; senile

老聃.definition: another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]

老臉.definition: self-respect of old person; face; thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism); brazen

老臘肉.definition: (coll.) experienced and usually well-positioned middle-aged man

老舍.definition: Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist

老莊.definition: Laozi and Zhuangzi (or Lao-tze and Chuang-tze), the founders of Daoism

老虎凳.definition: tiger bench (torture method in which the victim sits with legs extended horizontally along a bench, upper legs held down with straps while bricks are inserted under the feet, forcing the knee joint to bend in reverse)

老虎菜.definition: tiger salad, a northeast China dish usually consisting of hot pepper, cucumber, cilantro and leek

老蚌生珠.definition: lit. an old oyster producing a pearl (idiom); fig. birthing a son at an advanced age

老街.definition: Lao Cai, Vietnam; Laokai or Laukkai, Burma (Myanmar)

老調重彈.definition: to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal

老謀深算.definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect

老賬.definition: lit. old account; old debt; fig. old scores to settle; old quarrels; old grudge

老路.definition: old road; familiar way; beaten track; conventional behavior

老辣.definition: shrewd and ruthless; efficient and unscrupulous

老邊.definition: Laobian district of Yingkou City 營口市|营口市, Liaoning

老邊區.definition: Laobian district of Yingkou City 營口市|营口市, Liaoning

老鄉.definition: fellow townsman; fellow villager; sb from the same hometown

老闆娘.definition: female proprietor; lady boss; boss's wife

老頭.definition: old fellow; old man; father; husband

老頭兒.definition: see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]

老頭子.definition: (coll.) old man; (said of an aging husband) my old man

老頭樂.definition: backscratcher (made from bamboo etc); (may also refer to other products that are of benefit to old people, such as padded cloth shoes, mobility tricycle etc)

老馬嘶風.definition: old horse sniffs the wind (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations

老馬戀棧.definition: lit. the old horse loves his stable; fig. sb old but reluctant to relinquish their post (idiom)

老馬識途.definition: an old horse knows the way (idiom); an experienced worker knows what to do; an old hand knows the ropes

老驥.definition: old thoroughbred; fig. aged person with great aspirations

老驥伏櫪.definition: lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations

老驥伏櫪，志在千里.pinyin: lao3 ji4 fu2 li4 , zhi4 zai4 qian1 li3
老驥伏櫪，志在千里.definition: lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. old people may still cherish high aspirations

老驥嘶風.definition: old steed sniffs the wind (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations

老骨頭.definition: weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)

老鷹.definition: (coll.) eagle; hawk; any similar bird of prey

老鷹星雲.definition: Eagle Nebula, aka Star Queen Nebula, M16

老鼠尾巴.definition: lit. rat's tail; fig. a follower of inferior stature

老鼠拉龜，無從下手.pinyin: lao3 shu3 la1 gui1 , wu2 cong2 xia4 shou3
老鼠拉龜，無從下手.definition: like mice trying to pull a turtle, nowhere to get a hand grip (idiom); no clue where to start

老鼠拖木鍁，大頭在後頭.pinyin: lao3 shu3 tuo1 mu4 xian1 , da4 tou2 zai4 hou4 tou5
老鼠拖木鍁，大頭在後頭.definition: when the mice drag a shovel, the biggest thing comes second; the tip of the iceberg; the cockroach principle

老鼠過街，人人喊打.pinyin: lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3
老鼠過街，人人喊打.definition: lit. when a rat crosses the street, people chase it down (idiom); fig. everyone detests a lowlife

老齡.definition: old age; aging; aged; geriatric; the aged
